snippet: The International Monetary Fund called on the European Central Bank to begin buying government bonds to help hold down borrowing costs for troubled countries.
abstract: International Monetary Fund calls on the European Central Bank to begin buying huge volumes of government bonds to help hold down borrowing costs for troubled countries; such bond buying is a move the central bank has resisted, one that would probably outrage the fiscal conservatives of Germany.
lead_paragraph: The International Monetary Fund called on the European Central Bank to begin buying government bonds to help hold down borrowing costs for troubled countries.

headline.seo: I.M.F. Urges Europe’s Central Bank to Buy More Government Debt
headline.main: I.M.F. Warns of ‘Sizable Risk’ of Deflation in Euro Zone
headline.print_headline: Citing Deflation, I.M.F. Asks Europe Central Bank to Buy More Sovereign Debt
